isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON 2000 SERIES™ (LCT) TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - NEUTRAL START SWITCH FUNCTION

svcprocinfo.para: The neutral start function is provided by the neutral start/reverse signal switch (commonly called NSBU).

svcsubproc.title: 4700 Series Models
svcsubproc.para: Battery voltage from fuse F17 is supplied through circuit 97P to terminal E of connector (3026).

When the transmission is in NEUTRAL the switch contacts will close applying battery voltage on terminal G of connector (3026) through circuit 97AU, connector (386A) terminal C, connector (386B) terminal C, a jumper between connector (386B) terminals C to A, circuit 97A, connector (386A) terminal A, circuit 97L to the crank inhibit relay (661) terminal 30.

When the key is switched to the start position or the push button start is activated (with the key on) the crank inhibit relay will energize and the voltage at (661) terminal 30 will be applied to start relay (387).

svcsubproc.title: 3800 Model
svcsubproc.para: Battery voltage from fuse B1 is supplied through circuit 97P to terminal E of connector (3026).

When the transmission is in NEUTRAL the contacts of switch (3026) will close applying battery voltage on terminal G of connector (3026) through circuit 97AU, connector (386), a jumper between connector (386) terminals C to A, circuit 97L to the crank inhibit relay (661) terminal 30.

When the key is switched to the start position or the push button start is activated (with the key on) the crank inhibit relay will energize and the voltage at (661) terminal 30 will be applied to start relay (387).
